title: Is there a difference between PMBoK 5th edition and 6th edition? - Quora

response.answer_text: I love PMBOK and hence track it really closely. If you consider changes from processes perspective then they are not much different, but if you consider from approach perspective then lots of mindset changes can be tracked to accommodate recent developments in overall field of management. Few important are: Introduction of Agile methodology: It becomes important as we are moving from “proven traditional” works to “something new” works. It add to uncertainty which does not work well for waterfall method. So instead of putting long term detailed planning, it is being advised to make it smaller and progress as you explore along the way.Inclusion of recent market changes: With the changing work scenario, PMBOK has managed to include many situations in its content, which keeps it up to date.Resources are broken in to two parts: Human resources are now called project team and other resources are called resources like material, machine, equipments, etc.There are many such changes which makes it relevant. To simplify entire book I would recommend you to find a book on Amazon (search for B07BJBNF74) to quickly learn entire concept of PMBOK 6th edition in shortest possible time. All the best! Ashok

PMBOK 6: The 10 Knowledge Areas & 49 Processes A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK Guide) 6th Edition was released September 2017. The new PMBOK Guide 6th edition contains 978 pages, including the Agile Practice Guide (186 pages). When compared with PMBOK Guide 5th edition was only 616 pages, the 6th edition is one of the major content updates.
